mean_cn: n. 脱衣舞，打油诗，滑稽戏，笑剧，杂耍，漫画；  adj. 滑稽的，可笑的；  v. 讥笑
mean_en: a kind of entertainment that was popular in the U.S. in the late 19th and early 20th centuries and that included funny performances, singing, dancing, etc., and sometimes performances in which women took off their clothes
sentence: As a burlesque dancer, she was used to men's greedy eyes.
sentence_trans: 作为一个舞女，她习惯了男人们贪婪的眼神。
